availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Indiana
Vandenburgh County } SS

Whereas by a Commission from Thomas E. Bramlette Governor of the State of Kentucky, bearing date the 12th of July AD 1865 I have been appointed Commissioner of Deeds for the State of Indiana for the term of Four years from that date.
Now I hereby solemnly swear, that I will well and truly execute and perform all the duties of said station during my term of said office

State of Indiana
Vandenburgh County } SS

I Blythe Hynes Clerk fo the Vandenburgh Circuit Court hereby certify that on this 15" day of July 1865 the above named Azro Dyer appeared before me in my office and subscribed the foregoing affidavit and made oath thereto.
Witness my hand and the seal of said Court at the City of Evansville Indiana this 15 day of July AD 1865.
Blythe Hynes Clerk for H. W. Bippus D C

Comr Deeds
Azro Dyer
Commissioner of Deeds for the State of Kentucky
Filed
17 July 1865
